name: office-excel-add-in-open-in-teams
title: Open data from your web site in a spreadsheet in Microsoft Teams
shortDescription: Creates a new Excel spreadsheet in Microsoft Teams containing data you define. Embeds your add-in into the Excel spreadsheet. Creates a message in Microsoft Teams with a link to the new spreadsheet.
longDescription: Creates a new Excel spreadsheet in Microsoft Teams containing data you define. Embeds your add-in into the Excel spreadsheet. Creates a message in Microsoft Teams with a link to the new spreadsheet.

thumbnails.alt: Sequence diagram showing an "Open in Microsoft Teams" button on your web site that creates a message in Teams with a link to the spreadsheet with your data which contains your add-in.

references.name: Excel add-ins documentation
references.description: With Excel add-ins, you can use familiar web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build a solution that can run in Excel across multiple platforms, including on Windows, Mac, iPad, and in a web browser.

references.name: Use the Microsoft Graph API to work with Microsoft Teams
references.description: Microsoft Teams is a chat-based workspace in Microsoft 365 that provides built-in access to team-specific calendars, files, OneNote notes, Planner plans, Shifts schedules, and more.

references.name: Welcome to the Open XML SDK 2.5 for Office
references.description: The Open XML SDK 2.5 simplifies the task of manipulating Open XML packages and the underlying Open XML schema elements within a package.
